# indent-string [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/sindresorhus/indent-string.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/sindresorhus/indent-string)

> Indent each line in a string


## Install

```
$ npm install indent-string
```


## Usage

```js
const indentString = require('indent-string');

indentString('Unicorns\nRainbows', 4);
<<<<<<< HEAD
//=> '    Unicorns'
//=> '    Rainbows'

indentString('Unicorns\nRainbows', 4, {indent: '♥'});
//=> '♥♥♥♥Unicorns'
//=> '♥♥♥♥Rainbows'
=======
//=> '    Unicorns\n    Rainbows'

indentString('Unicorns\nRainbows', 4, {indent: '♥'});
//=> '♥♥♥♥Unicorns\n♥♥♥♥Rainbows'
>>>>>>> 98a706b637be300e31a3be4156fabed33e909f9e
```


## API

<<<<<<< HEAD
### indentString(input, [count], [options])

#### input

Type: `string`

String you want to indent.
=======
### indentString(string, [count], [options])

#### string

Type: `string`

The string to indent.
>>>>>>> 98a706b637be300e31a3be4156fabed33e909f9e

#### count

Type: `number`<br>
Default: `1`

<<<<<<< HEAD
How many times you want `indent` repeated.

#### options

Type: `Object`<br>
=======
How many times you want `options.indent` repeated.

#### options

Type: `object`
>>>>>>> 98a706b637be300e31a3be4156fabed33e909f9e

##### indent

Type: `string`<br>
Default: `' '`

<<<<<<< HEAD
String to use for the indent.
=======
The string to use for the indent.
>>>>>>> 98a706b637be300e31a3be4156fabed33e909f9e

##### includeEmptyLines

Type: `boolean`<br>
Default: `false`

Also indent empty lines.
